titleStmt.title: A short treatise discovering the prevailing excellency of the death of Christ with the Father, by way of opposition to that doctrine, that Christ dyed alike for all. Declaring in whom only the saints happinesse doth consist by meanes of this their purchased redemption: also their freedome from the guilt and curse of the Law. / Written for the satisfaction of some, if it may be. By Richard Marryat.
titleStmt.author: Marryat, Richard.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for William Larnar, and are to be sold at his shop in little Eastcheape,

notesStmt.note: Thomason received his copy on July 27, 1643.
Thomason annotation: 'the guilt and curse of' crossed out and replaced by the same phrase in MS.; "July ye 27 1643".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
